snippet: The Taliban targeted employees of a media company after threatening in October to attack it. At least seven people were killed and dozens wounded.
abstract: Taliban suicide attack in Kabul kills six employees of Afghan TV production company and one other person; fulfills extremist group's earlier promise to attack Afghan TV stations after news broadcast reporting rape of female students in Kunduz by militants.

byline.original: By DAVID JOLLY and JAWAD SUKHANYAR
byline.contributor: Ahmad Shakib and Mujib Mashal contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Taliban targeted employees of a media company after threatening in October to attack it. At least seven people were killed and dozens wounded.

headline.main: Taliban Suicide Bomber Strikes Packed Bus in Kabul
headline.print_headline: Following Up on Threat, Taliban Strike at Bus Carrying TV Employees
